metadata.name: Suspicious Executable File Creation
metadata.comment: Detect creation of suspicious executable file names. Some strings look for suspicious file extensions, others look for filenames that exploit unquoted service paths.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower(':\\$recycle.bin.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower(':\\documents and settings.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower(':\\msocache.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower(':\\perflogs.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower(':\\recovery.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.bat.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.sys.exe'))))

output.summary: Detect creation of suspicious executable file names. Some strings look for suspicious file extensions, others look for filenames that exploit unquoted service paths.
